newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile shares end mixed as market awaits Greenspan.
newsitem.headline: Chile shares end mixed as market awaits Greenspan.

text.p: Chilean stocks closed mixed in lighter-than-average activity on Tuesday as investors looked over company results and a slew of economic figures released during the day, dealers said.
The bolsa is seen opening weaker on Wednesday, with the focus centered on congressional testimony by Alan Greenspan, chairman of the U.S. Federal Reserve, they said.
"Foreign investors are nervous about what Greenspan will say," said one trader. "If they stay away, then the bolsa could sink further." The selective index ended 0.34 percent lower at 114.15 points.
Traders said the bolsa, which has steadily lost ground in recent sessions, could find support at about 112 points.
The general index gained 0.01 percent at 5,324.79 points on trading of shares valued at eight billion pesos.
Investors welcomed industrial output and unemployment data that confirmed that the economy was slowing, while they attributed February's high inflation to one-time seasonal factors, traders said.
